page.title: 02GREAT HONEYBOROUGH
page.content: {Great Honeyborough}is just off the main Milford Haven to Pembroke road. Formerly a collection of 3 or 4 farms and a few labourers' cottages, the village now boasts two modern housing estates which sprang up about 10 years ago. The estates provide homes for a mainly middle-aged population and their offspring are now in their late teens and early twenties. Most people from the estates who are in work, travel to Milford Haven or Haverford- west and not to Neyland to work. The main feature is the{'Green' with the older properties, a pub 'The Oddfellows', bus stop, telephone and post box. There are also benches, trees and flower beds and the Green is still a meeting place for the older residents and a playground for the younger children. by Lorraine Groves
